body: I mean since its already released fixing this is a must.
Once Polyamorous is updated, Active Admin's gemspec [will need to be updated as well](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/blob/7d86ea9a6ec55fcb0203f87972f6fb6a10cc9800/activeadmin.gemspec#L30).

Hi @pcreux, @amrnt, @rosenfeld and @seanlinsley.

Thanks to @huoxito and his deep dive into ActiveRecord, there is a new `rails-4.1` branch on Polyamorous that you might want to give a try. 

In your Gemfile:

`gem 'polyamorous', github: 'activerecord-hackery/polyamorous', branch: 'rails-4.1'`

I got Rails 4.1.0.beta1 working with Active Admin by putting this in my Gemfile:

```
gem 'activeadmin', github: 'gregbell/active_admin'
gem 'polyamorous', github: 'activerecord-hackery/polyamorous'
gem "formtastic", github: "justinfrench/formtastic"
gem "ransack", github: "activerecord-hackery/ransack", branch: "rails-4.1"
gem "devise", github: "plataformatec/devise"
```

@adamniedzielski Yes, concerning Ransack and Polyamorous those are the correct versions to use for Rails 4.1.0.

We should have 4.1.0 support merged into Ransack master soon, while maintaining the separate optimized branch for 4.1.0.
@adamniedzielski, just an fyi, I added those to my gem file.  Rails is able to run, but I can't install active_admin.

I followed the instructions from @adamniedzielski to install active_admin on top of rails 4.1beta (master). I could not detect any error, but all the assets and the secret key for the devise initializer was missing.
